programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Steve Irwin loved sea turtles. Terri and Robert continue his legacy as they transport three rescued sea turtles to Lady Elliot Island on the Great Barrier Reef - for the first time, by air. This complex mission is vital in order to help conserve these beautiful but endangered animals. While Robert and Terri take to the skies, Bindi and the team are nervously waiting for the birth of Australia Zoos first Sumatran tiger cub in three years. Richie from the rescue unit helps with a baby wallabys struggle for survival

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Zoe Ball presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 10 July 1998. Featuring B*witched, Matthew Marsden, The Jungle Brothers, Karen Ramirez, Destinys Child, Mansun, Eagle-Eye Cherry and Billie.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 17 July 1998. Including performances from Billie, Celine Dion and The Bee Gees, Pras Michel featuring ODB and Mya, Eagle-Eye Cherry, Five Mousse T feat Hot n Juicy, Garbage and Another Level.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mike Read presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 October 1981. Featuring The Tweets, Toyah, Altered Images, Gidea Park, The Creatures, Bad Manners, Dollar and Adam and the Ants. Also, a dance sequence by Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Franklin and Claudia Simon present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 1 October 1992. Featuring Stereo MCs, Crowded House, Doctor Spin, Dr Alban, Bob Marley and the Wailers, Bizarre Inc featuring Angie Brown, Status Quo and The Shamen

programme.title: Country Kings at the BBC
programme.desc: A chronological compilation of performances from the BBC archive by male country singers, ranging from the Everly Brothers and Jerry Lee Lewis to Garth Brooks and Willie Nelson. Featuring classic songs from studio shows by Glen Campbell, Charley Pride, George Hamilton IV, Kenny Rogers, Clint Black, Johnny Cash and Eric Church

programme.title: Kenny Rogers in Concert
programme.desc: Country music icon Kenny Rogers stars in a television special from 1979, recorded during a visit to England. He is joined by pop-country vocal group Dave and Sugar. First broadcast 10 January 1979

programme.title: Tammy
programme.desc: Country music star Tammy Wynette sings her favourite songs and introduces fellow Nashville star George Hamilton IV at The Maltings in Suffolk. First broadcast 24 August 1977

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.sub-title: The Old Grey Whistle Test Special: Emmy Harris
programme.desc: A one-off concert by the country star and the Hot Band recorded for the Old Grey Whistle Test in 1977, including performances of Luxury Liner and Tulsa Queen. Bob Harris presents

programme.title: Emmy Harris: From a Deeper Well
programme.desc: Profile of the highly respected singer, who has spent the past 30 years building an impressive body of country music. Discovered by Gram Parsons, Harris and her former backing group the Hot Band revolutionised the genre in the 1970s and 1980s, re-interpreting it for successive generations of fans. She then went on to release Wrecking Ball, one of the most critically acclaimed albums of the 1990s. Featuring interviews with friends, colleagues and admirers including Elvis Costello, Willie Nelson and Keith Richards

programme.title: Kenny Rogers in Concert
programme.desc: Country music icon Kenny Rogers stars in a television special from 1979, recorded during a visit to England. He is joined by pop-country vocal group Dave and Sugar. First broadcast 10 January 1979

programme.title: The Flying Gardener
programme.desc: Arriving in the Lake District, Chris Beardshaw dons his waders and goes in search of the ultimate water feature

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried gives a friends daughter some experience in the surgery, and Calum is resentful until he sees the young student. Rural drama, starring Robert Hardy, Christopher Timothy and John McGlynn

programme.title: Rosalie
programme.desc: In 1870s Brittany, a woman born with hair covering her body desires to be seen for who she is. Period drama, starring Nadia Tereszkiewicz. In French

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson is joined by actress Julie Andrews and her director husband Blake Edwards. First broadcast in 1974

programme.title: The Two Ronnies Sketchbook
programme.desc: Messrs Corbett and Barker reminisce about some of the best moments from their career, including the classic Fork Handles sketch, and theres a final chance to catch up with the work of the Phantom Raspberry Blower. Katie Melua provides an interlude to the comic mayhem with a performance of Crawling Up a Hill. From April 2005

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletchers midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Crime and Punishment - The Story of Capital Punishment
programme.desc: Documentary examining the history of capital punishment, including the protocol of public execution and the science of hanging. Archive information reveals the offences that resulted in the gallows and how children as young as seven were hanged

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Gaby Roslin host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: SAS: Catching the Criminals
programme.desc: Greater Manchester Police make multiple raids on suspected organised crime gangs. Ex-SAS leader Billy Billingham joins the teams searching for ill-gotten gains

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of holiday lets in Blackpool and Llanfynydd and a semi-detached house in Wolverhampton, finding out what the new owners have done with the properties

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In the beautiful surroundings of Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, the red and blue teams cut a dash as they make their way around the bountiful stalls on the hunt for profit. In red, Heathrow Airport colleagues Keeley and Sohesh buckle up to take on the blue team, teachers Becca and Mike, under the watchful eye of experts Danny Sebastian and Kate Bliss. Presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp observes the contest and also meets dapper young period tailor Zack Pinsent from Brighton, who at the age of 14 was inspired to begin dressing like a Regency gent every day

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Great Slaughter is buzzing with excitement for the annual talent show, which has a huge cash prize and a celebrity judge. However, the excitement turns to panic when an egotistical magician is killed during his act. Rather than an accident, Sister Boniface suspects murder. John Thomson guest stars, with Lorna Watson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Armed with a healthy budget of £450,000, Jules Hudson property shops with a couple wanting to make a permanent move from Kent to the scenic East Riding of Yorkshire. They are in search of a house with space for a burgeoning catering business. Jules also heads to Bridlington where he tests his sea legs in a traditional fishing boat unique to the area

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.sub-title: Luxury Watches and a Rare Teddy Get Rehomed
programme.desc: Auctioneer James Broad and restorer JJ Chalmers help a Wolverhampton couple with a passion for collecting. JB falls in love with some valuable wristwatches, and JJ resists temptation when he restores a drinks cabinet to its former glory

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show where three couples face a series of 50/50 questions which hurtle down the Answer Run towards them. Across three rounds, the couples build up their cash pots, but only one pair can face the Final Run and earn the opportunity to take home their cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Angela Rippon

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.sub-title: 03/10/2025 - The Social Democratic and Labour Party
programme.desc: By the Social Democratic and Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Angellica Bell host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Auctioneer Izzie Balmer and restoration expert Saf Fakir help best friends Sally and Lynn fund a much-needed holiday. Izzie discovers a treasure trove of jewellery, and hidden under a bed, a beautiful 19th-century French mantelpiece clock. Meanwhile, Saf uses his skills to revive a mid-century draw-leaf table. He also uses some unconventional methods to restore a brass statue to its former glory

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles leads a team of experts in Leicester helping seven-year-old Isla, a bright and determined little girl who dreams of living more independently in her own home. Born with a rare genetic condition, Isla requires a fully bespoke environment - from accessible furniture to specially designed living spaces. However, creating a home that supports her now and into the future is no small feat. With limited space and a long list of bespoke adaptations, the team members face one of their biggest logistical and emotional challenges yet

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell fronts the satirical current affairs quiz, as it returns for its 70th run. Team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton are joined by actress Sheila Hancock and actor and comedian Miles Jupp to poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: How Are You? Its Alan (Partridge)
programme.desc: The broadcaster reintegrates into life in Britain after a year working in Saudi Arabia, dedicating his efforts into a series of issues-led films. Leaving behind a lucrative career voicing radio commercials, Alan makes a bravely personal and personally brave return to TV to make Britains first ever documentary about mental health. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan, with Felicity Montagu and Tim Key

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes global music star Taylor Swift, inviting her to discuss her album The Life of a Showgirl. Also appearing are Oscar-winner Cillian Murphy, who is playing the head teacher in reform school drama Steve and actors Greta Lee and Jodie Turner-Smith, who are appearing together in sci-fi reboot Tron: Ares. Plus, Domhnall Gleeson talks about his new comedy role in The Office spin-off The Paper and Lewis Capaldi performs Something in the Heavens

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The queens are tasked to channel the spirit of Claudia Winkleman as they play their very own version of The Traitors. Next, they take on one of Drag Races toughest challenges - the Design Challenge - but, of course, theres a twist. The queens must rumble in the jumble sale as theyre tasked with creating looks from leftover items from Drag Race UKs previous series. Supermodel-turned-comedy star Michelle de Swarte joins the judging panel alongside Michelle Visage and Graham Norton

programme.title: Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa
programme.desc: The hapless local radio DJ ends up in the centre of a siege when colleague Pat Farrell gets fired by the stations new owners, only to respond by returning to the studio with a shotgun and taking hostages. The police enlist Alans aid as a negotiator, giving him the chance to revive his own flagging public profile. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan, Colm Meaney and Felicity Montagu

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebutt is joined by chefs Paul Ainsworth and Donal Skehan who help prepare recipes for guest Greg James to taste. Helen McGinn chooses the wines and Carmen ONeal celebrates International Vodka Day

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef witnesses a fishing method frozen in time, where the use of engines and winches is banned, and goes fishing under sail for what he considers to be the best oysters in the world. Back on dry land, Rick cooks a warming fish soup called Cullen Skink, and discovers the all-but-forgotten story of Cornwalls ancient capital, Lostwithiel

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekends matches, including Chelsea v Liverpool. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Leeds United and Tottenham Hotspur

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Oswestry in Shropshire, and visits a museum of model cars. Experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper assist the teams in finding a bargain

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and siblings David and Harry Rich head to Barnet to meet a man living in a period Victorian house that he loves, but with a garden he feels is boring. Billy dreams of a new space that fuses a Victorian cottage garden with an Amazonian twist, something that can transports him to hotter climes without having to leave north London. It must have a barbecue and an entertaining area, be full of lush tropical planting and have a water feature. Arit, David and Harry set out to help him achieve his dreams

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse is in Norfolk, with a buyer who wants to move closer to her family, and who has her son in tow for support. With the popularity of the staycation, Denise also meets someone who has taken the idea of mobile homes on wheels to a whole new level

With limited space and a long list of bespoke adaptations, the team members face one of their biggest logistical and emotional challenges yet

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where contestants and their celebrity partners must outsmart each other to win a cash prize. Featuring Kaye Adams, Jeff Brazier, Lauren Layfield, Zara McDermott, Jenny Powell and Lou Sanders

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Paddles at the ready as the couples take to the floor to perform their second routines - and this week things are getting serious for the celebrities as they know that one of them will be voted out in tomorrow nights results show. Claudia Winkleman and Tess Daly keep things ticking over, while Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke give their thoughts on the dances

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts as Scott Mills, Rylan, Zoe Ball, Tony Blackburn, Jo Whiley, Trevor Nelson, Michael Ball and Sally Traffic Boazman compete to win money for charity and to be crowned the Weakest Link Radio 2 champion

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: Alliances form, enemies are made, and lines are drawn as the passengers search for food and water. When another passenger dies, they realise they may all be targets

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Chelsea v Liverpool at Stamford Bridge and Arsenal v West Ham United at Emirates Stadium. Chelsea claimed a 3-1 home win over Liverpool last term, but the Reds had already secured the league title. Arsenal had lost to London rivals West Ham in front of their own fans in each of the last two seasons. Plus, Leeds United v Tottenham Hotspur, Manchester United v Sunderland and Bournemouth v Fulham

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Sports reporter Kelly Somers sits down in conversation with Hugo Ekitike to talk about his career as a striker for both Liverpool and the France national team

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic comedy based on the turbo-charged PlayStation video game franchise. In the future, cyberterrorism has devastated entire continents and survivors of the technological meltdown create walled fortresses to protect from lawlessness and further attacks. Couriers known as milkmen drive their souped-up cars across danger-filled wastelands to ferry goods between the citadels. One milkman, John Doe, accepts an assignment from New San Franciscos chief operating officer Raven to collect a valuable consignment from New Chicago. If successful, John will be granted citizenship. The mission takes John though Las Vegas where he encounters resourceful car thief Quiet. They joins forces to outrun a psychopathic clown named Sweet Tooth, who controls the desert strip

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John finds his mission thwarted by two unpredictable adversaries in Lost Vegas. Agent Stone recruits new members for his cause

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 7.30pm). All the action from the match at Leigh Sports Village. Champions Chelsea won all three meetings between the teams last season, prevailing 1-0 home and away in the league and 3-0 in the FA Cup final at Wembley Stadium. However, United started the current campaign brightly and will be hopeful of a more positive result in front of their own fans this time around

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark
programme.desc: The shadow of the Bellows family has loomed large in the small town of Mill Valley for generations, and young Sarah Bellows turns her tortured life and horrible secrets into a series of scary stories. These terrifying tales soon have a way of becoming all too real for a group of unsuspecting teens, who stumble upon Sarahs spooky home. Horror, starring Zoe Margaret Colletti and Michael Garza

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guy and Jamma visit Guys family home to pick up his childhood diary for writing inspiration. When Jamma meets Guys mother and brother, he makes a perfect first impression, much to Guys despair. However, all hell breaks loose when an unwelcome guest makes a frightening and confronting appearance. Mark Gatiss guest stars, with Mawaan Rizwan, Russell Tovey and Emily Lloyd-Saini

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys book launch finds the venue double-booked with a wedding. When the bride goes missing, its Jammas time to shine - he goes to look for her to save both the launch and the wedding. Elsewhere, its still awkward between Winnie and Isaac after their near kiss, while Farida uses the launch as her chance to get Saif to sign the divorce papers. Comedy, starring Mawaan Rizwan, Russell Tovey and Emily Lloyd-Saini

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Bowie is babysitting and Vince is in crisis, but Reema is there to help him through it. Keeks is keen to take the next step with Santi, and Oly is thinking about her future with Michael. Bowie, looking for love in all the wrong places, joins Dom on his first mandate with Tim at a microbrewery, where he spills the beans on the inspiration behind his dads friend-finding app. Later, an awkward run-in with Angie and Edith results in the talk Dom and Angie had been putting off. Santi and Oly join Skye and Madison and Karl and Austin at the school parents 1980s trivia night fundraiser, where they get a solid lesson in how not to grow up. Bowie gets unexpectedly lucky at last, but things go very wrong for him. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Oly makes an important declaration, but shes blindsided with an outcome she wasnt hoping for. Santi and Oly face an emotional reckoning when a frightening crisis forces them to confront what really matters. Vince and Reemas relationship finally crosses a threshold, as Ariels birth preparations push them together. Zac brings Talia back to the fold, and things get real for Ariel, Talia and Vince as Ariel goes into labour - life will never be the same again. The birth of their baby pushes some long hidden truths into the open. Hectors bonding with Gabe looks like good news for Rosa, until Gabe takes things too far. A loved-up Bowie has a chilling omen for Angie and Edith. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The queens are tasked to channel the spirit of Claudia Winkleman as they play their very own version of The Traitors. Next, they take on one of Drag Races toughest challenges - the Design Challenge - but, of course, theres a twist. The queens must rumble in the jumble sale as theyre tasked with creating looks from leftover items from Drag Race UKs previous series. Supermodel-turned-comedy star Michelle de Swarte joins the judging panel alongside Michelle Visage and Graham Norton

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: The writer and actor heads to Wiltshire, home to ancient sites such as Stonehenge, Avebury and the Westbury chalk horse, to get to the bottom of why humans feel the need to leave marks on the landscape. He turns his investigation towards the far more recent phenomenon of crop circles, hoping to settle a debate that has plagued his family for years. They think that crop circles are the work of aliens, but Charlie strongly doubts that belief

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guy and Jamma visit Guys family home to pick up his childhood diary for writing inspiration. When Jamma meets Guys mother and brother, he makes a perfect first impression, much to Guys despair. However, all hell breaks loose when an unwelcome guest makes a frightening and confronting appearance. Mark Gatiss guest stars, with Mawaan Rizwan, Russell Tovey and Emily Lloyd-Saini

programme.title: Juice

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord takes Amy back to the darkest days of the Second World War, when a Nazi victory looked certain, to find that Winston Churchill has made use of an unlikely weapon - the Daleks. Deep below military headquarters, scientists believe they have made the aliens follow their orders, but the Doctor remains unconvinced. Ian McNeice (Doc Martin) and Bill Paterson (Law and Order: UK) guest star alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan, in an episode written by Mark Gatiss

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Doctor and Amy face a terrifying trek through the Maze of the Dead after being asked to track down the last of the Weeping Angels following the crash of a space ship into a ruined temple. The mission reintroduces the Time Lord to the mysterious River Song (Alex Kingston), and he has to work out if he can trust her. Guest starring Iain Glen (Game of Thrones) with Matt Smith and Karen Gillan, and featuring a cameo by Mike Skinner of the Streets

programme.title: Doctor Who Confidential
programme.desc: As the mysterious River Song returns to the series, actress Alex Kingston discusses the highs and lows of playing the character - as well as her relationship with the Doctor. Production staff talk about the return of the Weeping Angels, and Matt Smith takes part in the making of a new online game based on the series. Narrated by Alex Price

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Bank Holiday Monday sees the Essex contingent arrive for a sunny day at the beach in Barry. Gavin has a heart-to-heart with his dad, which gives him much to think about, while a dark cloud looms on the horizon when Dave arrives to find Nessa and Smithy enjoying all the fun of the fair. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones star

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Preparations for Nessa and Daves wedding are in full swing, Stacey has life-changing news for Gavin, and Bryn and Jason put their big secret to bed once and for all. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine. / The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. programme.sub-title: Puffs Perfect Picnic/Run, Mushpie, Run/Watch the Storm/Lightning Bark

Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / When Chep asks Mush-Mush and Lilit to go storm-watching and they refuse, Lilit feels bad and convinces Mush-Mush to join their friend. / Fung and Miff have come across a rare piece of bark struck by lightning.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Special Delivery/The Perfect Fritter/The Art of Friendship/What a Stinker

When Mush-Mush gets to taste one, he can’t believe it: Sushi-Mushi has cooked the perfect fritter. / When Chanterelle sees how good Lilit is at painting, she offers to help her dig into her talent. / Chep is very excited: tonight, a rare and extremely stinky plant is going to bloom! But he already promised Mush-Mush to play their favourite game.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Save The Fun Tree/Stuck In The Mud/Get The Egg Home/Fly, Chase, Fly/Oh My Compost/Snails Forever
programme.desc: Mush-Mush and friends’ favourite play tree is rotten and doomed. Our friends, track down Starmush, hoping his powers can save it. / When Fung and Miff spoil Mush-Mush’s fun tunnel surprise he has been working on for ages, he wishes their day was ruined too. / When an egg blows down into the village, it is Mush-Mush and friends’ mission to return it to Mush Mountain. / Chep is disappointed Mush-Mush and Lilit are too busy leaf-gliding to play moss-ball with him, so he hangs out with a new weevil friend instead. / When Sushi-Mushi breaks the only spoon he has ever cooked with, he declares his cooking days are over! / Chep wants to return a favour to Mush-Mush, but all Mush-Mush wants is to have a compost pancake on Pancake Day!

programme.desc: ...Lemmings/Remote Control/The Bear and the Butterfly/Get Off My Tennis Shoes/Babysitting/Bear Under Lock And Key/Lemming Blues/Snow Lemmings => An old metal box found by chance in a recess of a cliff brings back childhood memories for Grizzy and the Lemmings. / How can one peacefully watch a documentary on salmon, nice and comfy on the sofa, when the Lemmings are playing chemistry with a fun experiment box? / Grizzys TV remote is stolen and stored high up in a tree. / Grizzy wants to offer a butterfly to his beloved she bear. / The Lemmings have discovered an addictive new game based on the astonishing bouncing properties of the rangers new running shoes. / Grizzy babysits for the she-bear he has a crush on. Theres no question of Grizzy tripping up, for he has no intention of taking any risks! / Unwilling to share the food both he and the Lemmings are wild about, Grizzy locks it up inside the ranger’s brand new and apparently burglar proof safe. / Grizzy is impressed by the TV show of a magician who transforms a partridge into a bouquet of flowers. / On a very hot day an ice cream commercial awakes the desire of Grizzy.

Mushables pull pranks all over Mushton, and Mush-Mush has an epic one planned. / When ants invade Fung and Miff’s tree, our Mushlers offer for them to move in… but the two quickly turn out to be unbearable roommates. / Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: ...Space/Sniffer Sniffler Raccoon/Transformational Bear/Shaken-Up Bear/Piñata Party/Bear Game/Ranger Lemming => The Lemmings have discovered a truly wild new game: an augmented reality program on the rangers digital tablet. / The only edible food item left in the rangers cabin is a gorgeous salmon which is stuck inside a block of ice at the back of the freezer compartment. / The Lemmings have unearthed a box filled with birthday fountains of light that spit forth giant bursts of sparks. / Grizzys last jar of chocolate spread was pinched by the Lemmings who are savoring it in secret. / Wedged in his sofa to relieve his aching back Grizzy balks at getting up. / The vibrations created by Grizzys snoring during his nap give the Lemmings an idea for a bouncing game. / Grizzy finds a piñata in the rangers living room. The idea of breaking a papier-mâche statue with a bat like it says in the instructions pleases him. / Inside a mysterious cave Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a magical Game of the Goose. / Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Save The Fun Tree/Stuck In The Mud/Get The Egg Home/Fly, Chase, Fly/Oh My Compost
programme.desc: Mush-Mush and friends’ favourite play tree is rotten and doomed. Our friends, track down Starmush, hoping his powers can save it. / When Fung and Miff spoil Mush-Mush’s fun tunnel surprise he has been working on for ages, he wishes their day was ruined too. / When an egg blows down into the village, it is Mush-Mush and friends’ mission to return it to Mush Mountain. / Chep is disappointed Mush-Mush and Lilit are too busy leaf-gliding to play moss-ball with him, so he hangs out with a new weevil friend instead. / When Sushi-Mushi breaks the only spoon he has ever cooked with, he declares his cooking days are over!

programme.desc: When Moletown experiences a heatwave, Moley and Dotty hope Mishmosh can invent something to cool things down. / Moley must learn to Molerskate for the Great Mole Roll skating competition and discovers his parents have a hidden talent. / When an egg rolls into Moletown and a duckling hatches, Moley must play momma to the baby duck until they can find its home. / When Moley helps take care of the worms at Dotty’s Adopt a Worm Rescue Center, the Gardener sends Squirm to pose as a homeless worm and help him steal Manny. / When Moley’s Keeper duties are pulling him in too many directions, he gets Manny to create multiple Moleys!

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lolas family are from Spain, a country in southern Europe. She is making a traditional Spanish dish called empanadas for her and her friends. Lola begins by rolling out two pieces of pizza dough into big circles. She cooks one in the oven. Lola adds tomato puree to passata to make the filling. She also adds some canned tuna, green olives, and boiled egg. She seasons the mixture with paprika, black pepper and her special ingredient, oregano. Then Lola spreads the filling over the dough, which has been in the oven. She finishes the recipe by adding the last piece of dough on top and then putting it back in the oven to cook. Will Lolas friends find the empanadas tasty? Will they guess her special ingredient? Theres a very exciting Spanish surprise waiting for her friends while they enjoy their meal!

The children are placed with headmistress Annie Waterbury, whose husband is away at war, and her son Thomas. Eventually the youngsters stand up to injustice close to home when they encounter a soldier on the run. Sequel to beloved family drama The Railway Children, starring Beau Gadsdon, Jenny Agutter, Sheridan Smith and Tom Courtenay

programme.title: The Great Hurricane of 1990
programme.desc: The story of one of the worst storms to hit the UK in centuries, when hurricane-strength winds damaged three million trees and 47 people were killed. This documentary examines how, despite the warnings, this violent daytime storm sent shockwaves across Great Britain and how the heroism of everyday people ensured the death toll wasnt higher. It also explores how we have learned to adapt and survive in the decades since to avoid further tragedy in the face of adverse weather

programme.title: The Palace: What the Royal Servants Saw
programme.desc: Documentary giving an inside look at the secret lives of the royal family, from the point of view of those who worked closest to them, the royal servants. Interviews with former staff and insiders reveal what its really like behind the palace walls and the daily challenges, dramas, tantrums and traumas that unfold away from the public eye

programme.title: The Trial of Paul Burrell
programme.desc: A look at the collapse of Paul Burrells 2002 trial for theft after the former butler of Diana, Princess of Wales was charged relating to hundreds of royal items found in his possession. The story is told through reconstructions based on court transcripts, and contributions from witnesses, reporters, the court artist, legal experts, and members of the prosecution team, revealing that before Burrell could take the stand, an intervention from Elizabeth II collapsed the trial just nine days after it began

programme.title: When TV Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford narrates a compilation of on-air disasters from chats shows, featuring stroppy hosts, technical troubles and on-screen bust-ups. Highlights include Russell Harty getting an unfortunate blow to the groin, John Stapleton being attacked by Rod Hulls Emu, Spike Milligan handling an unexpected guest on Wogan in a way that only he could, and TV veteran Eamonn Holmes lifting the lid on his worst interview ever, with a practically mute David Blaine

programme.title: Wogan: The Great Entertainer
programme.desc: A celebration of the life and work of much-missed broadcasting legend. With the help of old friends, colleagues and fellow broadcasters, cameras chart Terry Wogans rise from Dublin bank clerk to national treasure. Theres also a look at his most memorable moments, taking in the likes of Eurovision, Blankety Blank, Wogan and Children in Need - and not forgetting his first love, radio

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Flight
programme.desc: Documentary examining the royal familys history with air travel, from the first Kings Flight in 1936 to the modern-day journeys undertaken by Queen Elizabeth II. Cameras step inside the private world of regal life in the air, uncovering the mysterious traditions and protocols behind royal travel, from the story of the Queens Commonwealth tour in 1953 to the unique challenges presented in more recent times

programme.desc: Though Joey is thrilled when his name is used in a magazine crossword puzzle, he is reluctant to let the publication do a profile of him after his last magazine interview got him fired. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebes fear that she may be about to lose her latest boyfriend is compounded by Rosss foolish comments. Monica makes a startling discovery about Chandler while visiting him in Tulsa, and Joey is upset to learn his date does not remember having previously slept with him

However, the miniature flying saucers have the odds stacked against them as they bravely do all they can to save the day. Sci-fi fantasy, starring Jessica Tandy, Hume Cronyn, Frank McRae and Elizabeth Pena.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son embark a 3,000-mile journey through Europe, aiming to experience extremes from the fiery heat of the Mediterranean to the icy tundras of the Arctic Circle. They begin in Croatia, where they swing off the roof of Hajduk Splits football stadium, before diving headfirst into the crystal-clear waters of the Adriatic. The action continues when the pair go head-to-head on aqua bikes alongside a former world champion, before heading to the capital Zagreb to meet a young inventor, who stuns them with his electric creation

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad

Meanwhile, Raja pushes the boundaries with Lucy, but puts their relationship in jeopardy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny bond as they miss Leonard, and Howard tries to help Raj get over his break-up with Lucy. Meanwhile, Bernadette and Amy visit an out-of-town biology convention. Comedy about four high-achieving scientists, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends compete in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj to test their scientific knowledge and life skills, but the game brings out the best and worst in everyone. As the hunt progresses, Howard and Amy begin to bond over their shared musical tastes, while Penny and Sheldon work together as a team and Bernadette becomes fiercely competitive

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Meanwhile, Leonard realises he can manipulate Penny into feeling sorry for him when his mother publishes a reveal-all book about his childhood problems. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa has to go undercover as a nun and infiltrate a convent when Maggie goes missing after being left on its doorstep. Meanwhile, Marge is left temporarily blind when she stares at a total eclipse, so Homer has to sort out their rat-infested kitchen

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: In the Name of the Grandfather
programme.desc: After ducking out of a bonding session with Grampa, a guilt-ridden Homer vows to make it up to his father by granting him a wish. The old man decides to visit Ireland and drop in on his favourite pub from his army days. Upon arrival, the pair discover the bar is a shadow of its former self, and agree to buy the business and turn its fortunes around

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer takes Ned Flanders advice and starts praying regularly, hoping God will lend a sympathetic ear and make it possible for him to buy a better home. Marge warns that his materialistic attitude may incur divine retribution, but he turns a deaf ear - until a flood of biblical proportions hits Springfield

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart learns that he was once a child celebrity, but that Homer spent all the money he made, so he separates from his parents and moves into a loft apartment, where his neighbours are punk band Blink-182 and skateboarding hero Tony Hawk

programme.title: The Greatest Showman
programme.desc: After losing his job as a shipping clerk, PT Barnum creates and develops his circus in New York in the mid-1800s with the help of playwright Phillip Carlyle and an adopted family of entertainers shunned by society. Musical drama, starring Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron, Michelle Williams, Rebecca Ferguson and Zendaya

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Im Spelling as Fast as I Can
programme.desc: Homer develops a ravenous appetite for Krustyburgers new spare rib sandwich, while Lisa is offered a scholarship at the college of her choice - but only if she agrees to deliberately lose a spelling contest

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Glamorous Hollywood star Sara Sloane visits Springfield and becomes infatuated with Ned Flanders, who finds himself asking Homer for dating advice. Featuring the voices of Helen Fielding and Marisa Tomei

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: With changes afoot at Springfields airport, Bart persuades Krusty to run for Congress so he can redirect the flight path of planes passing over the Simpson home. However, he soon alters his policies once elected

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Eco-disaster looms in Springfield when Mr Burns launches a controversial fracking operation - and while Homer is more than happy to play accomplice to his boss, an outraged Lisa calls on the services of bigshot politician Maxine Lombard (voiced by two-time Oscar winner Jane Fonda) to shut Burns down. Against the odds, however, the opponents end up falling for one another

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In a crossover episode with Futurama, the Planet Express crew members travel back in time and turn up in Springfield on a mission to prevent the troublesome family from destroying the future. Its not just a question of asking nicely however - Bender has been programmed to kill Bart, Terminator-style. Can the clan foil the murderous bot?

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, including Nick and Liv Grimshaw, Rylan and his mother Linda, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Micah Richards and Jamie Carragher, Martin and Roman Kemp, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aleshe and Mel C and her brother Paul, turn their hand to being the countrys most opinionated viewers, sharing their opinions on Stranger Things, This Is MY House, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, For Soccer Aid, The Savoy, Million Pound Pawn, Romeo and Duet, and BBC News reporting on the demise of Neighbours. From June 2022

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Squid Game: The Challenge, Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, The Crown, Deal or No Deal, Planet Earth III, Made in Chelsea and Saving Lives at Sea. From November 2023

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics sit down to watch Squid Game: The Challenge - the real-life version of the Netflix hit - and get hot under the collar with Channel 4s swinging drama The Couple Next Door. Plus, The Toy Hospital, Survivor, Vinnie Jones in the Country, Tony Robinsons Marvellous Machines and Lorraine. From December 2023

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A 20-year-old glamour model, a 28-year-old financial head-hunter and a 27-year-old man who has been single for several years are among the singletons meeting possible partners at the restaurant. At the end of their restaurant meal, the couples decide whether they want to take things further, and if the answer is no, the next date sitting opposite them could be a viewer

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Interactive documentary in which singletons meet up with possible partners from the internet for the first time. is editions participants include a 31-year-old on his first-ever date, hoping to overcome his nervousness about the opposite sex, a 4ft 11 man looking for a woman to love him for who he is, and Phil from last week, having gone commando on his previous date, is hoping his lucky pants will do their job when he meets well-groomed Home Counties girl Sarah

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In an episode set 30 years in the future, Bart and Lisa now have families of their own and decide to spend Christmas with Homer and Marge. However, when they turn to their parents for advice, the pair discover they have more in common with their mother and father than they realised

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon re-evaluates the time he spends with Amy when she takes a job at the university. Meanwhile, Howard is forced to sleep on his friends sofa after he gets into an argument with Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Heaton Park in Manchester, where one of the first open air concerts was held in 1909, before travelling on to the town of Oldham. Michael then ventures to Edale in the Peak District, where he joins ramblers in walking country, and learns how a Sheffield socialist spearheaded a mass trespassing revolt to open up the countryside to working people

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Piccadilly Circus to Gravesend, visiting an exotic West End store that was popular among Victorian women and hearing how a Russian ballet company took London by storm in 1909. He also discovers the origins of netball and gymslips at North Kent College and meets the pilots of the Port of London Authority, founded in the early 20th century

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Bradshaws guide, Michael Portillo reaches Birmingham and discovers how a radical reformer made his mark on the city of a thousand trades. At Highbury Hall, he finds Joseph Chamberlains mansion home and hears how he established a political dynasty including a prime minister and a foreign secretary. Next stop is Cradley Heath, once one of five chain-making towns in the West Midlands. At the centre of Britains ceramic industry in Stoke-on-Trent, Michael visits Wedgwood, established by Queens Potter Josiah Wedgwood in 1759 and visited in 1913 by King George V and Queen Mary

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Maltby to Hinckley, investigating the high-octane sport of whippet racing and trying to understand the appeal of Marmite. Plus, he has a look around the Triumph motorcycle factory and learns about the first of these vehicles to be built

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads from Warwick to Rye in East Sussex. In the orchards of East Malling, Kent, Michael discovers how the Edwardians serious attitude towards cultivation bears fruit even now. In Folkestone, he hears how the town coped with an influx of more than 100,000 refugees fleeing the German invasion in 1914. In the High Weald, Michael heads for Tenterden Town and the light railway that opened in 1900. His final stop is the medieval Cinque Port of Rye, where he tours the home and garden of author Henry James

programme.title: The Black Arrow
programme.desc: A knight returning home from fighting in the Wars of the Roses returns home to discover his father has been murdered. A family friend fighting for the other side has been blamed for the crime, but the knight tries to prove his wicked uncle is responsible. Swashbuckling adventure based on Robert Louis Stevensons novel, starring Louis Hayward and Janet Blair

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: A Navy captain reluctantly takes command of an old US destroyer during the Second World War and struggles with a crew who do not respect his authority. However, the prospect of facing the mighty German force brings much-needed unity. Adventure, starring Trevor Howard, Richard Attenborough, Bernard Lee, Sonny Tufts and James Donald

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: Biopic of Winston Churchill, following the future prime ministers formative years. While working as a journalist, he travels to Africa to report on the Boer Wars, an assignment that leads to his incarceration in a prison camp. He escapes from captivity and returns to England to begin a political career. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft and Robert Shaw

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: A foppish royalist nobleman leads a double life as a Roundhead-baiting highwayman. However, after Cromwells final victory at the battle of Worcester, the dashing hero has to smuggle the son of Charles I to safety in France. Swashbuckling adventure, starring George Baker, Sylvia Syms, Marius Goring, John Le Mesurier and Patrick Troughton

programme.title: Daddys Home
programme.desc: A mild-mannered man hopes for his wifes two children to view him as their father. His dreams of perfect family life are threatened by the return of their biological father, a charismatic, motorcycle-riding tough guy, and he pulls out all the stops to prove to his stepchildren that he can be just as cool. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg

programme.title: Plane
programme.desc: On New Years Eve, Trailblazer Air pilot Captain Brodie Torrance takes flight with handcuffed prisoner Louis Gaspare on board. A direct lightning strike forces Torrance and co-pilot Dele to emergency land on a remote island under the control of militia leader Junmar. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler and Mike Colter

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
programme.desc: Faded television actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double Cliff Booth strive to hang on to their careers during the final years of Hollywoods Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. As they navigate a changing film industry they barely recognise any more, they are drawn into the orbit of both ill-fated rising star Sharon Tate, and Charles Manson and his cult of zealous followers. Drama from director Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Timothy Olyphant and Al Pacino

programme.title: Slow West
programme.desc: A Scottish teenager travels to America at the end of the 19th century. He travels across the frontier in the hope of being reunited with the woman he loves, aided in his travels by a mysterious drifter and stalked through the wilderness by an outlaw. Western, starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Michael Fassbender

programme.title: A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Miser Ebenezer Scrooge is given a Christmas Eve to remember when a quartet of ghosts - his dead business partner and the spirits of Christmases past, present and future - turn up determined to cure him of his money-grubbing ways. Adaptation of Charles Dickens classic, starring George C Scott, Nigel Davenport, Frank Finlay, Angela Pleasence, David Warner, Edward Woodward and Susannah York

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: An ordinary teenager is recruited by a mystical martial arts master for a vitally important quest. He must find seven magical spheres before they fall into the hands of an evil warlord, who intends to use their power to let him take over the world. Fantasy adventure based on the Japanese cartoon series, starring Justin Chatwin, Chow Yun-Fat and James Marsters

programme.title: Babys Day Out
programme.desc: Three bungling kidnappers hatch a plan to pose as society reporters and snatch the baby son of a wealthy couple. However, the infant escapes on to the streets of New York, evading the crooks every attempt to recapture him. Comedy, starring Joe Mantegna, Lara Flynn Boyle, Joe Pantoliano and Brian Haley

programme.title: Fatherhood
programme.desc: A father brings up his baby girl as a single dad after the unexpected death of his wife who died a day after their daughters birth. Comedy drama, starring Kevin Hart and Alfre Woodard

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster caused by mysterious arms dealer John Lark and a group of terrorists known as the Apostles. However, Hunt and his colleagues are soon pushed to their limits thanks to a face from their past. Writer/director Christopher McQuarries sixth entry in the action thriller saga, starring Tom Cruise, Henry Cavill, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg and Rebecca Ferguson

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: Small-time crook Tony Montana emigrates from Cuba to the US, determined to become rich and powerful. Admitted into the inner circle of a Miami drug lord, he ultimately takes over his bosss empire and even his wife. However, his paranoia and cocaine addiction begin to spiral out of control, while his enemies circle, waiting for the chance to bring him down. Gangster thriller remake, with Al Pacino, Michelle Pfeiffer and Robert Loggia

Western, starring Jeff Bridges, John Hurt, Ellen Barkin and David Arquette

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A local nightclub owner is admitted with symptoms of poisoning, and his son is quick to point the finger of suspicion at his fathers glamorous wife. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike and Jackie suffer a terrifying ordeal at the hands of a stalker out for revenge, and David holds the fort while Greengrass and Bernie help to arrange a funeral with a difference. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.desc: Paul is distracted by his kiss with Gray, only to be hurt when his friend brushes it off as a mistake. Carrie realises she may be forced to admit the truth to Scarlett if shes to avoid alienating another daughter.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The Peacocks find a camera in the car - and one of the photos proves Claire has been telling the truth about Casey. Bill agrees to take David back.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The wounded officers arrive at Downton and Matthew suggests he bring General Sir Herbert Strutt to inspect the new convalescent home - but Branson decides to spoil the visit after failing his army medical. Meanwhile, Williams return results in an awkward surprise for Daisy, and Violet and Rosamund discover Lavinias past misdeeds. Costume drama, starring Dan Stevens, Allen Leech, Thomas Howes, Maggie Smith and Zoe Boyle

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Hypochondriac Malcolm Rayner is struggling with his breathing and Martin asks him if he has ever worked with asbestos. Penhale then causes pandemonium by putting up warning notices about the substances harmful properties throughout the village. Meanwhile, Bert pops the question to Jennifer, and Ruth finds fault with Als business proposal. Guest starring Christopher Fairbank (Auf Wiedersehen, Pet)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A local church suffers a series of thefts and the finger of suspicion seems to point to the vicarage, of all places. Meanwhile, Greengrasss hopes of winning a dog show take a knock when his pedigree contestant goes missing. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A former MPs lascivious past catches up with him just as he is planning a comfortable retirement, and Greengrass makes his presence felt at the village bonfire party as only he knows how. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, William Russell and Joanna David

programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: The son of a high-profile Jewish businessman is attacked in the grounds of a university, leaving Foyle to consider the possibility that the attack was racially motivated. Meanwhile, in London, tensions mount as charismatic right-wing leader Guy Spencer is released from prison. But is he being set up to take the spotlight off a dangerous espionage operation involving MI6? Elsewhere, Sam becomes acutely aware of the impact of the war on Adams constituents as she encounters a young boy suffering from whooping cough. Michael Kitchen stars in the 1940s-set crime drama, with Honeysuckle Weeks and Daniel Weyman

programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: The last-ever episode. When his colleague Hilda Pierce is targeted by an assassin outside MI5, Foyle must re-examine her top-secret role during the war. He suspects the shooting could be connected to the hunt for a traitor within the Special Operations Executive who may have been behind the deaths of nine agents in France. Meanwhile, Sam is faced with a dilemma when Adam and Glenvil crack down on the black market in East Peckham. Guest stars include Conleth Hill (Game of Thrones Lord Varys)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Tony and Carol investigate when the grisly remains of recent murder victims are unearthed during excavation work on the foundations of a hotel. When the building is subsequently burned to the ground, Tony suspects dark forces from the distant past are still very much active - and wonders whether the fact the hotel was built on the grounds of a ruined abbey could hold a clue to the mystery

programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: First episode of the drama, starring Michael Kitchen as a jaded police superintendent who would rather be fighting the enemy in France than crime on the south coast as the Second World War gathers pace in 1940. However, when a local magistrates German wife is murdered amid a growing cloud of uncertainty and anti-Nazi feeling, the ensuing investigation is anything but routine. Edward Fox, Robert Hardy, David Horovitch, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks co-star

programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: It is July 1945 and, as Britain settles into peacetime, Foyle looks forward to retirement, but finds his life in turmoil once more when Samanthas employer Sir Leonard Spencer-Jones is found dead. Suspicion falls on Niko, a Russian PoW, who flees the Sussex coast and heads for a sanctuary in London - closely followed by Foyle, who has been sent to track him down by the War Office. But the investigation soon brings to light a conspiracy and an international cover-up which, if exposed, could bring down the British government. Max Brown joins the cast, with Michael Kitchen, Honeysuckle Weeks, Anthony Howell, Eleanor Bron and Christopher Good

programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: As Foyle prepares to be replaced at the police station and begin retirement, his attention is grabbed by a news story about a man sentenced to hang for high treason, and he decides to take on the case. But with the prisoners execution date approaching, the detective has to work fast to find evidence that will clear him. Meanwhile, Samantha and Adam fight to save Hill House from the town planners determined to demolish it - but disaster soon strikes. Starring Michael Kitchen, Honeysuckle Weeks and Max Brown

programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: Its 1946 and although one war has ended, another is looming as the Iron Curtain falls across Europe. Foyle arrives home from America, where he is wanted in connection with a suspicious suicide, but MI5 offers him a way out. The agency suspects Britains atomic research programme has been infiltrated and wants to recruit him to investigate a Soviet spy ring that could be at work in the heart of London. Detective drama, starring Michael Kitchen, with Honeysuckle Weeks, Ellie Haddington and Dylan Charles

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The members of amateur operatic society the Midsomer Mummers are busy rehearsing for their charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in their theatre. Barnaby and Winters investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to be centre stage. Crime drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Nick Hendrix, with Kevin Whately, Samantha Spiro and Shobna Gulati

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called to the University of Northumberland when Jamie Marshall, a promising young journalism student, falls to his death from the top of a disused faculty building. With no eyewitnesses and no immediate leads, Vera turns to friends and family to glean all she can about Jamie, and to discover who might have wanted him dead. The students innocent facade is revealed to have concealed simmering resentment and anger which he expressed on the internet - and which may have made him some deadly enemies

programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: The detectives investigation into the death of a nameless Russian leads to a mysterious military facility run by Colonel Harry Galt, a respected soldier with an impeccable war record. However, as Foyle makes inquiries, he realises the deceased was a spy with dangerous connections to British Intelligence. Meanwhile, Sam does her best to help husband Adam during his by-election campaign, but cant help putting her foot in it. Crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Honeysuckle Weeks, with Jonathan Hyde and Daniel Weyman

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell tell more stories of people desperate to find missing family and answer questions that have haunted entire lives, beginning with two men searching for the truth about their beginnings. Paul Connolly had a brutal childhood and was put out with the rubbish as a baby in east London and raised in care, while Shaun Lawrence had a happy adoption with wonderful parents but was always curious about his birth parents

programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Miners Arms in Nenthead, Cumbria, where sisters Alison Baker and Lynda Clark hope that their eco credentials will impress their guests. However, brothers Andrew and James Widdas have to face their fear of shared bathrooms. The group get crafty by upcycling old rubbish, allowing Nigel and Pok U Regan to show off some hidden talents. At dinner, Kev Argent and Tor Johnson realise theres stiff competition from their fellow greenies. In the morning, Alison and Lynda face some tough feedback over facilities

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brothers Andrew and James Widdas aim to provide boutique on a budget at the Rose and Crown in Edgworth, near Bolton, but they only have eight months of experience, and BandB veterans Alison and Lynda are quick to find fault. During an afternoon of decorating gingerbread houses, Pok U and Nigel are accused of trying to bribe the hosts, and as the concept of boutique is shot down over dinner, there are simmering tensions. In the morning, Kev and Tor wonder whether anyone can challenge professional chef Andrews breakfast spread, and Andrew and James struggle with some of their feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nigel and Pok U Regan cultivate an east-meets-west atmosphere at their BandB and Cantonese restaurant, the Bingham Townhouse in Nottinghamshire. Their guests arent all happy when they arrive, with Andrew and James unsure about sleeping in single beds. Kev and Tors focus and meditation skills are tested when the group are challenged to an archery competition. Alison and Lynda are staggered when they find out that Nigel bought the BandB on a whim, and have a bad taste in their mouths when he calls them sweet and sour. At breakfast, Nigel struggles to run a smooth service

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Float by Boat near Rugby, partners Kev Argent and Tor Johnson run mindfulness breaks from their narrowboat, Spirited Away. Alison and Lynda arent keen on the tiny shared bathroom, tight space and curtained-off bunks, and Andrew and James fret over communal living. Theres tension following Nigel and Pok Us feedback, so Kev and Tor try to unite their shipmates with group meditation. At breakfast, questions are raised over the confused branding, and at feedback time all of the guests facilities scores leave Kev and Tor speechless

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet for the last time to find out what theyve been paid and to settle some scores. Mike and Neal from the Highlands Pub challenge the comments that they were considered dirty and lacking in facilities, while Sean and Kathryn from the White House are left smarting after suffering large underpayments for what they think are minor issues. Eventually, the winner is finally revealed

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Stockport to take on a 1994 Vauxhall Cavalier Turbo owned by Darren, who is unable to move from the neck down after an accident. With the car gathering dust on the drive, Darrens friends are hoping Fuzz and Tim can convert it to allow him to be a passenger and satisfy his need for speed again

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend take on their 100th motor - a 1978 MGB GT, their first electric conversion. The car used to belong to family man Jeff. When Jeff died, he left his unfinished MG project to his daughter Caroline, who promised her father she would complete the restoration. Can the team help Caroline fulfil her fathers dying wish?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two young couples who were struggling to take their first step onto the property ladder. He was in Leeds with Charlie and Hayley, who had been searching fruitlessly for nine months, unable to make a decision for fear of making the wrong one. In south-east London, Nicki and Rob wanted somewhere big enough to start a family when Kirstie and Phil suggested an unusual solution. How are both couples getting on now?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer meets new parents Dom and Arta who are looking to get back into the housing market after selling their first flat and moving into a rental but Liverpool-native Dom is shocked by how little their budget of £1million will buy them. First-time buyers Beth and Rory are facing a no-fault eviction and turn to Kirstie Allsopp for help finding their first home but a nasty fall puts their search on hold

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Leigh Osborne and Graham Voce want to convert and extend a landmark 150-year-old water tower in Kennington, south London, into a luxury home. Grade II-listed, derelict and with 6ft-thick walls, its a huge challenge for the pair, who also plan to build two structures at the base - a lift shaft connected by a series of glass tunnels, and a modern living space. The result will be a four-bedroom property over nine floors, complete with a room at the top offering spectacular 360-degree views across the capital. Presented by Kevin McCloud

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: French-Canadian crime thriller. Celine Trudeau heads back to her hometown, a place resonant with personal ghosts. On the first night, she discovers that a decomposed body has been dug up in her Uncle Leopolds apple orchard. Alexandre arrives to take charge of the case, but Celine has her own suspicions about the identity of the long-dead body and her unpopular familys dark history is about to be raked over in the public eye. In French

Alans wife Jenny reveals how she met him and how a sudden accident involving her son burst their idyll and took their lives on an unexpected path

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition starts in Filey, North Yorkshire, at The White Lodge Hotel, where hosts James and Kim Hodgson hope their love of luxury and high standards will impress their guests. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: The contest ends at glamping site Camp Katur in Kirklington, North Yorkshire, where Kerry Roy and Nicola Wilding hope to wow their guests with their unique geodomes and see-through pods

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the contest arrives, and while Amanda Lucia-Charley and Alan Talbot receive harsh criticism of their breakfast, Mark and Jean Lees decor receives scathing reviews

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.sub-title: Grand Designs: Living in the Country
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud looks at the challenges of self-building in the countryside, where design must embrace and enhance tradition, yet often overcome stringent planning constraints. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Cork have struggled in the Airtricity Premier Division this term, but have fared much better in the cup, and recorded a comfortable 3-0 win at Finn Harps in the quarter-finals of this competition. St Pats reached this stage with a 3-1 home win over Galway United after extra time in the previous round, and will hope to continue their excellent form in meetings against the Rebel Army this term, having won three of the four league games to take place, with the other ending in a draw

programme.title: Grand Designs: House of the Year

They include a bold contemporary barn, forged from corten steel and concrete, a small urban house squeezed into a plot the size of a London Tube carriage, and a Scandi-Scottish lochside bolthole, hewn from Highland stone and Danish oak. The others are a wooden wonderland extension in east London and a Surrey home with an extraordinary engineered timber roof

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by rail through Queensland, marvelling at the engineering expertise of a railway line built in the 1890s. He visits a plantation where he learns how to harvest sugar cane, finds out how the townsfolk of Innisfail withstand the tropical storms that strike the region and ventures into the hinterland, where he braves a crocodile safari. At Mungalla Cattle Station, he hears how aboriginal people faced brutality at the hands of 19th-century settlers and after a singalong, he makes tracks for his end destination of Townsville - the gateway to the Great Barrier Reef

programme.title: Tina (2021)
programme.desc: Born Anna Mae Bullock in 1939, Tina Turner has sold in excess of 100 million records and earned numerous plaudits including Grammy awards and induction into the Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame with her first husband, Ike Turner. She was the first woman to grace the cover of Rolling Stone magazine and dabbled in acting including a memorable performance opposite Mel Gibson in Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome. Following a prolonged period of ill health, Turner intends to retire from the spotlight with her second husband, Erwin Bach. She bids farewell to her fans in the emotional documentary Tina. Directed by Dan Lindsay and TJ Martin, the film invites the singer to reminisce about her turbulent life and career with glowing contributions from friends, family and fans including Oprah Winfrey and Angela Bassett
