programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Expectant mother Hayley has been anxious since her 20-week scan, which revealed her baby has a rare type of hernia that could restrict the development of its lungs. She and partner Pete have been unable to plan for their childs future as the condition is potentially life-threatening, but they try to remain positive throughout the labour, knowing that the most difficult period will come immediately after the birth

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: After their twins are born, Nick and Nina decide to move in to Ninas childhood home with her mum. Can Jonathan and Drew transform the place to make it work for everyone?

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team help Scott Jones, a 17-year-old disabled athlete in Cheltenham, who is eager to become more self-sufficient at home, with the challenge including added side and rear extensions, a wet room, access to an adapted kitchen and a state-of-the-art gym studio. Scott won gold at the 2013 IPC world championships and aims to develop his talents in order to participate at the 2020 Paralympics in Tokyo

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: The final seven contestants must deal with a Mystery Box filled with garlic - and another secret ingredient

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: A pensioner is involved in a domestic assault, and a driver is trapped in his car after an accident. Plus, cheese and holidays feature among the cab crews favourite luxuries

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The response team race to the rescue of a worker trapped in a collapsed trench, and paramedic Kim must risk her own life to give him medical treatment 10ft underground

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A truck driver is trapped in his crushed cab after a motorway smash, while in Hull, firefighters handcuff a man to the rails of the Humber Bridge to stop him from jumping

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: The very first episode of the award-winning comedy kicks off with Edina and Patsy hitting the bottle as they struggle to cope with career and family pressures. Starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina is horrified when Bubble tells her she is about to be visited by Penny Caspar-Morse, an ultra-thin model she knew in the 1960s who used to torment her about her weight. She decides to lose some weight, but abandons her exercise programme and lets Patsy schedule her an appointment to have liposuction. Comedy, guest starring Alexandra Bastedo, with Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina and Patsy set off for a break in the heart of rural Provence, only to find their chateau is nowhere near as luxurious as they were expecting. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha. From November 1992

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers fly solo this week, giving them a chance to demonstrate their individual abilities as they transform shepherd huts into boutique boltholes on a glampsite in north Wales. The client is a brand-new business so they have a blank canvas to work on, and having been given individual briefs by Michelle Ogundehin, each designer takes a different approach to turning these tiny spaces into luxury living accommodation, with the challenge of an en-suite shower room and an outdoor space thrown in for good measure. What will Michelle and guest judge Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen make of the end results?

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Crews are sent to a 70-year-old with breathing problems who requires immediate surgery. Plus, paramedics are called to treat a seriously ill man who is showing signs of sepsis

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sleeplessness and a taxing workload catch up with Jack, who is lucky to escape from a road accident so bizarre his colleagues begin to suspect he is losing the plot. His protege Mickey Webb sets out to rescue his bosss reputation and save his career. An explosion in a lock-up on an industrial estate alerts Neil to possible terrorist activity in the manor

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Leela and Tony discover the body of a supermodel who had recently fronted an anti-fur campaign despite her lack of real conviction. Lorna notes that the crime scene has been arranged to resemble a shot from the film, suggesting animal rights activists may have resented her hypocrisy. Subsequent investigations reveal a host of rival male admirers with reason to kill her and Terry digs up evidence of a more sinister side to the womans life

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Known stalker Larry Franks emerges as prime suspect in the Cindy Statham murder case - until CCTV footage reveals the model had a furious row in a restaurant with her half-brother on the day she died. Leela reports an attack by an intruder but she is put in a compromising situation when her colleagues turn up and discover a bag of heroin in her flat

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry goes undercover, hoping to arrest a supplier of illegally imported goods, but gets caught up in a pub brawl between rival football fans in which a fellow officer is stabbed. Lewiss inside knowledge is called upon when another spate of gang violence breaks out and the new leader of the Skens appears to be settling old scores. Guest starring Adrian Lukis

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: After making a complaint about Ginas bullying behaviour, Emma is embarrassed to find herself working alongside the inspector on a tricky rape allegation in which the evidence does not seem to add up. CID learn of a big drugs deal being arranged in the cafe where Lewiss cousin works and prepare to swoop - but they are not prepared for what they find when the Sken gang turn up

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Its the biggest shift of the year on New Years Eve, and the responders deal with overzealous celebrations; a violent mental health case

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A record heat wave has the city at boiling point, and officers respond to reports of a woman assaulted by her partner

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Mosh and Kren tend to a 35-week pregnant woman with severe bleeding. Meanwhile, Paramedics rush to Sydney airport following a bomb threat

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Its Australia Day and the paramedics are swamped with alcohol-related calls, including one about a man found passed out in his car in the middle of the road

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a puppy who needs urgent treatment for a badly broken leg and a young Doberman who has spent most of her life in quarantine kennels

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete travels to Northern Ireland to pick up three stray dogs and bring them back to Essex. He also meets a Shar Pei who is in constant pain and may need surgery

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood and the challenges it has brought them, including Lisa and Will, whose first baby was born with his bowel outside his body. There are also updates on 41-year-old disabled mum Trish, who feared she would not be allowed to keep her newborn, and a couple who were hoping for a girl the fifth time around but instead got another boy

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood and the challenges it has brought them including Charlie, who gave birth at just 23 weeks to premature twins, baby Mia did not survive and her sister Isobel, who was left fighting for life. Meanwhile, Vicki believed that if she could handle getting a tattoo she could stand the pain of childbirth, and when Sara and Mark first met they already had four teenage children between them. Two years on the couple are now grandparents

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: Stacey Dooley: Inside Spains Narco Wars
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley gains unique access to the police, dealers and smugglers in southern Spain, to find out how it has become the main gateway for drugs into Europe.

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete in a commercial design challenge to redesign Oxfordshire show homes, with judge Michelle Ogundehin assessing their efforts with the help of guest Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margates most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics help a man suffering from anxiety who discovered he might have been exposed to HIV. Crews attend to a man found unconscious in the stairwell of a block of flats

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his Irish journey from Dromod to Sligo. Along the way he discovers how the landscape inspired the poet WB Yeats and learns to make a potato pancake

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the last leg of Michael Portillos long journey from Wexford to Westport, a fashionable Victorian seaweed bath is followed by a steamy scene in Ballina. On tenterhooks in Foxford, Michael discovers the visionary charity of an entrepreneurial nun, learns of a double tragedy at Clew Bay and begins a pilgrimage to the summit of Croagh Patrick, Irelands holy mountain

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with a 1936 edition of Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures onto the European rail network, beginning an emotional rail journey which takes him deep into his familys past. In the golden city of Salamanca in northwestern Spain, Michael visits the University to hear of opposition to the fascist takeover of Spain by General Francisco Franco, and gains access to the Generals archive of enemies of the state. Travelling onto the capital city of Madrid, Michael hears how the bombing of a small town in the Basque region in 1937 inspired one of the 20th centurys most shocking works of art, before making his way to the town of Huesca. Michaels final stop is on the border with France at Canfranc station, where he learns of the role the old terminus played in the evacuation of Jews during the Second World War

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1964 Ford Capri Consul coupe comes up for auction. Paul takes a 1957 Leyland Comet truck for a spin, and Dave admits that high on his wish-list is a Citroen 2CV

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the chateaux of the Loire Valley to the heart of the Champagne region at Reims, beginning in the city of Orleans in north-central France. Here, he follows his Bradshaws guide to the magnificent stained-glass windows of the Cathedral of Sainte-Croix, which tell the story of the heroine of France, Joan of Arc. Later, Michael takes a spin around the track at Le Mans in a French-built car, before making his way to the capital city of Paris. East of Paris, Michael finishes this leg of his journey in style with a tour of the cellars at Domaine Pommery in Reims

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures on a rail journey through Germany, guided by Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide published in 1936. Starting in the vibrant city of Berlin, Michael visits the Museum of Modern Art in Berlins Kreuzberg, where he sees how a leading artist of the era, George Grosz, warned of the rise of fascism in a haunting self-portrait. In the Schoneberg district of the capital, Michael researches the decadent night scene of the 1920s, and looks at how cabaret culture is being revived today. When he reaches Weimar, Michael investigates the beginnings of Bauhaus design and visits the movements first building, before travelling onto Stuttgart, where he takes a ride in a high-performance Porsche to the manufacturers Stuttgart headquarters

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: Fred looks at early experiments in the use of steam for road transport, more than 100 years before the invention of the petrol engine. Plus, an insight into the development of the traction engine for agriculture and haulage

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie tries to persuade John to part with the mammoth collection of football programmes that he has cherished for years, and attempts to convince Ann to clear out her storage unit, which contains 40 years worth of treasured gifts and memorabilia

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team are on a mission to prove to the nation that you can achieve the home renovation of your dreams without it literally costing the earth. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as 2 households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week. Each family has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

programme.sub-title: Cold Case Forensics: The Murder of Lynette White
programme.desc: Forensic scientist Dr Angela Gallop and her team detail the methods that helped them crack the 1988 murder of Lynette White in Cardiff. The case had resulted in one of Britains worst miscarriages of justice, and by 1999 it remained unsolved when a new detective squad brought in Dr Gallop and her forensic team to help solve the case. She and other experts, as well as police officers, lawyers and one of those wrongly accused, tell the story. Nicola Walker narrates

programme.title: Michael Palin in North Korea
programme.desc: Michael leaves Pyongyang and is put under the protection of armed guards as he is shown the Joint Security Area on the border with South Korea, where he has a tense exchange with a lieutenant from the Korean Peoples Army about the Korean War and the DPRKs nuclear weapons programme. He also travels to the east coast of the country and the seaside town of Wonsan, where he sees a massive tourist resort being constructed on the beach, although the nearby new international airport for an expected influx of passengers remains eerily empty

programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. Plus, Domhnall Gleeson talks about his new comedy role in The Office spin-off The Paper and Lewis Capaldi performs Something in the Heavens

In Cheshires golden triangle, Kathy meets savvy watch collector Anthony who is looking to trade up his collection of luxury watches for one worth more than £100,000

programme.title: The Body in the Bin: Who Killed Louise Kam?
programme.desc: What began as an audacious plot to defraud £5million from unsuspecting 71-year-old mother and businesswoman Louise Kam ended in her murder, after which her body was callously dumped in a wheelie bin on a driveway belonging to one of the killers. This documentary follows this shocking story of fraud, murder and the impact of social media

programme.title: Heartbeat

Vernons latest money-making scheme seems destined to end in disaster as David takes the wheel of an old Army vehicle, but his off-road tours are not for the faint-hearted. Nostalgic rural drama, guest starring Robert Glenister and Celia Imrie

programme.desc: Susanna Reid travels to Texas to meet convicted killer Billie Wayne Coble in the days leading up to his scheduled execution. If it fails, he will be the oldest man put to death in Texas for more than 100 years. Susannah asks Billie to relive the night of the crime and tries to find out how it has affected him and also speaks to his relatives and others involved in the case

After that, he heads to Hoedspruit Endangered Species Centre to meet Little G, an orphaned rhino who has been given a permanent companion, a sheep named Lamby

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: Dating show in which intrepid singletons hunt for a potential partner by rifling through their home before theyve even met. Here, 31-year-old Nadia from Liverpool house-hunts for love with the help of her sister Jenna. However, the tables turn when their chosen match gets to look around their home to decide whether to accept the date or stand them up. Narrated by Rochelle Humes

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: Terelle, a software engineering student at Leicester University, rifles through the homes of three potential suitors, testing their sofas for comfort and exploring the contents of their spice racks. He is looking for someone with a love of travelling and cosy nights in, and looks for the right signs in a family home, a disheveled country bungalow and a pristine bachelorette pad

programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize
